reviewText: This film brings the story of John Marin and his artwork to life.  If you love Marin, painting, architecture or American art, this documentary is for you.  You will see Marin's artwork up close and in a fresh way.

This film was more about the film maker than the artist. His physical presence on screen was distracting and unnecessary. John Marin was a significance artist, deserving of an appropriate homage. This 90 minute, torturous lecture exhausted me. I was one of a few still awake when it ended. I would have left after the first 20 minutes if I hadn't been sitting in the front row of the screening. I have spoken with others about the film. They concur. Look elsewhere for enlightenment.
